history.content: You have more than enough math to get started on research and your coursework is not nearly as relevant as research/research letters when it comes to grad school admissions. Taking hard mathy classes is honestly just going to slow you down from doing research; I know people who published multiple papers before 126/127/189. This is probably an unpopular opinion, and I haven't taken any of the grad courses you mentioned so I welcome other input.

You have more than enough math to get started on research and your coursework is not that relevant when it comes to grad school admissions. Taking hard mathy classes is honestly just going to slow you down from doing research; I know people who published multiple papers before 126/127/189. This is probably an unpopular opinion, and I haven't taken any of the grad courses you mentioned so I welcome other input.

So my background is Lower div: CS61ab70. EE16AB. Math 53,54. Upper div: CS170, 189. EE 126, 127. Math 104. Data100. 

The Grad courses of interest being offered next semester are: EE226 (if i can skip 120 prereq), 227B (if el ghaoui allows), Math 202A, CS281A, EE229A. I'm looking to also take a math class from {113, 221, 128ab}. My goal is grad school (phd) and to start doing research next semester in some form of machine learning / optimization.

Any course advice? Please let me know your email if you have taken many of these classes and are willing to talk more. Thank you so much!
